Simulate multiple fMRI time series with column-specific parameters

Source: R/simulate.R
simulate_fmri_matrix.Rd

Generate multiple fMRI time series where each column can have different amplitude and duration parameters drawn from specified distributions.

Usage

simulate_fmri_matrix(
  n = 1,
  total_time = 240,
  TR = 2,
  hrf = fmrihrf::HRF_SPMG1,
  n_events = 10,
  onsets = NULL,
  isi_dist = c("even", "uniform", "exponential"),
  isi_min = 2,
  isi_max = 6,
  isi_rate = 0.25,
  durations = 0,
  duration_sd = 0,
  duration_dist = c("lognormal", "gamma"),
  amplitudes = 1,
  amplitude_sd = 0,
  amplitude_dist = c("lognormal", "gamma", "gaussian"),
  single_trial = FALSE,
  noise_type = c("none", "white", "ar1", "ar2"),
  noise_ar = NULL,
  noise_sd = 1,
  random_seed = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  buffer = 16
)

Arguments

n

Number of time-series (columns).

total_time

Total scan length (seconds).

TR

Repetition time (seconds).

hrf

Hemodynamic response function, e.g. fmrihrf::HRF_SPMG1.

n_events

Number of events.

onsets

Optional numeric vector of event onsets.

isi_dist

Inter-stimulus interval distribution.

isi_min, isi_max

ISI range for uniform distribution.

isi_rate

Rate for exponential distribution.

durations

Event durations.

duration_sd

Standard deviation for duration sampling.

duration_dist

Distribution for duration sampling.

amplitudes

Event amplitudes.

amplitude_sd

Standard deviation for amplitude sampling.

amplitude_dist

Distribution for amplitude sampling.

single_trial

Whether to use single-trial regressors.

noise_type

Type of noise to add.

noise_ar

AR coefficients for noise.

noise_sd

Noise standard deviation.

random_seed

Random seed for reproducibility.

verbose

Whether to print messages.

Value

A list with time_series (matrix_dataset), ampmat, durmat, hrf_info, and noise_params.
